New Records: Zaccharie Risacher scored a career-high 33 points in the game.
He became the youngest player in Hawks history to score 30 points.
Risacher shot 8 out of 11 field goals and 6 out of 10 three-pointers.
Key Match Events: Risacher had a slow start but scored 16 points in the second quarter.
He made key plays in the fourth quarter, including two free throws to secure the win.
His performance was a turning point for the game.
Post-Match Reflections: Risacher's performance was praised by his coach and the team's management.
His success was attributed to the confidence built by the team's veterans and staff.
Miscellaneous Highlights: Risacher contributed with three rebounds, one assist, one block, and one steal.
The article mentioned the Hawks' recent struggles with three consecutive mediocre seasons.
